definition: to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)
variant of 恆|恒[heng2]
surname Heng

sentences.english: "I attended real life classes, but soon found it difficult to continue, " said Shi.
sentences.chinese: 我曾修过现实的课程，但很快我便发现很难持之以恒。

sentences.english: A regular bedtime and rising time can help you stablize your internal clocks.
sentences.chinese: 定一个规律的作息时间，持之以恒。

sentences.english: As long as assiduous and cultivated, perserve, final and regular meeting has good get one's own back.
sentences.chinese: 只要勤奋耕耘，持之以恒，最终一定会有好的回报。

sentences.english: A consistent, medium-intensity routine is a proven cold-stopper.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恒的中等强度的常规运动已被证明能防止感冒。

sentences.english: Four must explore and form the public education mechanism which a set perseveres.
sentences.chinese: 四要探索并形成一套持之以恒的宣传教育机制。

sentences.english: In the study, she also can perserve, continuous progress.
sentences.chinese: 在学习上，她也能持之以恒，不断进步。

sentences.english: Be in encouraging consumer to perserve the ground participates in new media to consume, go.
sentences.chinese: 二是鼓励消费者持之以恒地参与到新媒体消费中去。

sentences.english: As we will persevere in front of thorns.
sentences.chinese: 任前方荆棘丛生我们将持之以恒。

sentences.english: Consistency and authenticity will be key in leading tomorrow’s workforce.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恒和真诚将成为领导未来劳动力的关键所在。

sentences.english: Consistency and authenticity will be key in leading tomorrow's workforce.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恒和真诚将成为领导未来劳动力的关键所在。

sentences.english: But as with anything, persistence and practice is rewarded.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对于任何事情，持之以恒和练习都是必须的。

sentences.english: The dream was not easy to realized but insistance helps him wins.
sentences.chinese: 梦想是不容易实现，但持之以恒帮助他赢了。

sentences.english: Persevere, so can the stones penetrated.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恒，所以才能把石块打穿。

sentences.english: The secret of success iin constancy of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 成功之秘诀乃持之以恒。

sentences.english: Create a sleeping schedule and stick to it.
sentences.chinese: 制定一个睡眠计划表，并持之以恒地坚持下去。

sentences.english: If you like how you feel after three weeks you can stick with it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在三周后感觉不错，就可以持之以恒。

definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
untiring/unremitting/indefatigable
perseverance
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
to press on
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

definition: dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
untiring/without slacking
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
unswerving/unflinching
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
